johnson-goldwasser-2019-modeling.title: Modeling Behavioral Aspects of Social Media Discourse for Moral Classification
johnson-goldwasser-2019-modeling.author:
Johnson, Kristen  and
Goldwasser, Dan
johnson-goldwasser-2019-modeling.paperMotivationText: Automatic analysis of framing in social media discourse (tweets) is difficult due to the length constraint of tweets.
johnson-goldwasser-2019-modeling.paperContributionText: The authors propose a relational model based on Probabilistic Soft Logic (PSL) to predict moral foundations in tweets. The model takes into account retweets, the poster's social network and information about time activity between tweets.
johnson-goldwasser-2019-modeling.paperResultsText: All three aspects incorporated into the PSL model are helpful to predict moral foundations in tweets. The model is helpful to shed light on political discourse trends over time and policy issues in political tweets.
johnson-goldwasser-2019-modeling.resourcesOtherText: Twitter corpus by Johnson and Goldwasser (2018), Congress of Tweets https://github.com/alexlitel/congresstweets
